In 2010, the GOP posted big gains here., 105789=Updated: 7/2/13 12:32 AM EDT, 53385=The GOP presidential nominee hasn't carried Michigan since 1988, but Mitt Romney has high hopes of picking up the state because of its economic struggles and his personal ties -- he was born here and his father served as governor., 108444=Updated: 7/2/13 9:45 AM EDT, 26662=The most populous Mountain West state, Colorado has a growing Hispanic population and a politically active evangelical Christian community. Barack Obama was only the second Democratic nominee to carry the state since 1964., 33070=With 29 electoral votes, Florida is the nation's biggest battleground state. Home to large populations of senior citizens and Hispanics, the state voted for Barack Obama in 2008 and George W. Bush in 2004., 103431=Updated: 7/2/13 7:45 AM EDT, 62793=George W. Bush carried Nevada twice, but Democrats have made big voter registration gains since then and Barack Obama won by a 12-point margin in 2008. The state is one of those hit hardest by the home foreclosure crisis., 91339=Virginia has voted for the Democratic presidential nominee just twice since 1948. But the emergence of Democratic-leaning Northern Virginia as a political powerhouse has changed the equation, and the state's other metro areas have become increasingly competitive., 42438=Barack Obama carried Iowa easily in 2008, but the state was one of just two (the other was New Mexico) that voted for Al Gore in 2000 and George W. Bush in 2004. In both cases, the result was decided by less than a percentage point, 113578=Updated: 7/2/13 9:49 AM EDT}
